WorkItem.Description:
Steps to repeat:
Open rawr (open a file or not, works either way)
Choose druid/bear
tool-> default gems
Add this gem set
24sta 24sta 24sta 32sta2armor
Add this gem set
8dodge12sta 8def12sta 24sta 32sta2armor
click delete non-listed
click ok
Switch to cat model (so that the list re-sorts, making it easier to select)
tool-> default gems 
(the list is now prepopulated which is new in this edition from 2.1.4 though this bug happened in 2.1.4 as well)
Add this gem set:
16str 16str 16str 21agi3crit
Add next
16str 16ap8hit 16ap12sta 21agi3crit
Add next
16str 8haste8str 16ap12sta 21agi3crit
click delete non-listed
click ok
 
Something strange happens how.  You will see that last line deleted just before the stuff is refreshed.  
 
If you go to your hats and sort alphabetical you will see that there are only 4 gemmings being done.
 
The set default gems tab is now completely hosed and keeps behaving really strange no matter what you do at this point.  Try a few things you will see.  Weird stuff happens.
 
Closing and reopening Rawr clears the strange behavior until the next time you try to put in 5 or more gemmings at one time.
 
This probably works with any gemmings you select not specificly the ones I have above but I figured for completeness I would list them.
 
Workaround: Put in a couple gemmings clicking delete non-listed.  Close Rawr.  Reopen.  Put in more not clicking delete non-listed.
